definition: to herd/to breed livestock/to govern (old)/government official (old)

sentences.english: At last the goatherd threw a stone, and breaking its horn.
sentences.chinese: 最后这个牧羊人扔了块石头打破了羊的角。

sentences.english: So the king ordered that the marriage of the shepherd and the princess take place without delay.
sentences.chinese: 于是王下令，该牧羊人和公主的婚姻采取不拖延。

sentences.english: But there's another meaning given to shepherds as well.
sentences.chinese: 但是还有另一个附加在牧羊人上的含义。

sentences.english: A shepherd lost the whole of his flock by a dreadful illness .
sentences.chinese: 由于一场可怕的瘟疫，牧羊人的一群羊都死光了。

sentences.english: The shepherd guided his sheep down the hill.
GOATHERD hmarketing ci ampaign sought to recredined a stray goat to his flock.
sentences.chinese: 很多山羊被牧羊人赶到羊圈里。

sentences.english: Its mountains are breezily cool and inhabited mostly by goats and their herders.
sentences.chinese: 山上，凉爽微风轻拂着，仅有山羊与牧羊人长居于此。

sentences.english: A few days later, the angel came back to thank the sheepherder and asked what he wanted.
sentences.chinese: 过了几天，天使来答谢牧羊人，问他要什么。

sentences.english: Desperate, the shepherd began tugging them to the other side.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人不顾一切的拉着它们朝另一边走去。

sentences.english: The cattle were herded into the barn by the shepherd.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人把羊群赶进了农舍。

sentences.english: A good shepherd will lay down his life for his sheep.
sentences.chinese: 一个好牧羊人愿意为了他的羊群而牺牲他的生命。

sentences.english: As sheepherders, Zang and Gu lost some sheep due to their neglect.
sentences.chinese: 臧与谷两个牧羊人，他们都因疏忽而丢失了一些羊。

sentences.english: Only with a goal in view can we move in the right direction.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人用一根棍子赶着羊朝正确的方向去。

sentences.english: A shepherd is a tender of sheep.
The goatherd caught up with him and blamed his ungracious behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 牧羊人追上野山羊，责怪它忘恩负义。

sentences.english: Only the shepherd is stronger than the roaring lion that seeks to devour us.
sentences.chinese: 惟有牧羊人才强得过那寻找吞吃我们的咆哮狮子。

definition: Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
nomadic/to move about in search of pasture/to rove around as a nomad
